title: Stack overflow in forkchoice
body:
After an OOM on Witti, I restarted Teku. This was at a point when the chain had over 130 epochs without finalisation.

Resync to head succeeded, but was extremely slow, and produced quite a few of these stack overflow errors in the logs.

I did not specify any memory constraint.

```
2020-06-14 12:34:48.233+00:00 | TimeTickChannel-0 | INFO  | teku-event-log | ^[[37mSync Event  *** Current slot: 133374, Head slot: 132600, Connected peers: 4^[[0m
2020-06-14 12:35:00.232+00:00 | TimeTickChannel-0 | INFO  | teku-event-log | ^[[37mSync Event  *** Current slot: 133375, Head slot: 132600, Connected peers: 4^[[0m
2020-06-14 12:35:12.232+00:00 | TimeTickChannel-0 | INFO  | teku-event-log | ^[[37mSync Event  *** Current slot: 133376, Head slot: 132600, Connected peers: 4^[[0m
2020-06-14 12:35:24.233+00:00 | TimeTickChannel-0 | INFO  | teku-event-log | ^[[37mSync Event  *** Current slot: 133377, Head slot: 132600, Connected peers: 6^[[0m
2020-06-14 12:35:36.225+00:00 | TimeTickChannel-0 | INFO  | teku-event-log | ^[[37mSync Event  *** Current slot: 133378, Head slot: 132600, Connected peers: 6^[[0m
2020-06-14 12:35:40.287+00:00 | ForkJoinPool.commonPool-worker-7 | ERROR | SyncManager | Error during sync to peer Eth2Peer{id=16Uiu2HAmCGtAV3oz6giNDfVNDfsXidqrhEg2t376nxmwxMLi3yVk, remoteStatus=Optional[PeerStatus{forkDigest=0xf6775d07, finalizedRoot=0xabfa25a62fd102f81bbac4595d7cbc262c3e50fa08710bfea6b78664c156d2c4, finalizedEpoch=4034, headRoot=0x83e60e033445a1caecb782d48199d1e82877477475fb6ca5023562352f365642, headSlot=133373}]}

```

A few mins later, this appeared and Teku stopped dead (did not exit, but nothing happening):

```
2020-06-14 12:46:25.371+00:00 | events-14 | ERROR | teku-status-log | PLEASE FIX OR REPORT | Unexpected exception thrown for events-14
java.lang.StackOverflowError: Delayed StackOverflowError due to ReservedStackAccess annotated method
        at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquireShared(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1323) ~[?:?]
        at java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$ReadLock.lock(ReentrantReadWriteLock.java:738) ~[?:?]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.protoarray.ProtoArrayForkChoiceStrategy.blockParentRoot(ProtoArrayForkChoiceStrategy.java:238) ~[teku-protoarray-0.11.4-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.11.4-dev-b3262903]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.core.ForkChoiceUtil.lambda$get_ancestor$0(ForkChoiceUtil.java:94) ~[teku-ethereum-core-0.11.4-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.11.4-dev-b3262903]
        at java.util.Optional.flatMap(Optional.java:287) ~[?:?]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.core.ForkChoiceUtil.get_ancestor(ForkChoiceUtil.java:89) ~[teku-ethereum-core-0.11.4-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.11.4-dev-b3262903]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.core.ForkChoiceUtil.lambda$get_ancestor$0(ForkChoiceUtil.java:92) ~[teku-ethereum-core-0.11.4-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.11.4-dev-b3262903]
        at java.util.Optional.flatMap(Optional.java:287) ~[?:?]
<etc - several hundred lines of the same>
```

And on restarting, same thing. Looks like I can't get back on the chain ðŸ˜¢

This is the console output when Teku dies:
```
12:59:23.244 INFO  - Slot Event  *** Slot: 133496, Block:    ... empty, Epoch: 4171, Finalized checkpoint: 4034, Finalized root: abfa25..d2c4, Peers: 0
12:59:31.270 INFO  - Slot Event  *** Slot: 133497, Block:    ... empty, Epoch: 4171, Finalized checkpoint: 4034, Finalized root: abfa25..d2c4, Peers: 0
12:59:40.212 INFO  - Slot Event  *** Slot: 133498, Block:    ... empty, Epoch: 4171, Finalized checkpoint: 4034, Finalized root: abfa25..d2c4, Peers: 0
12:59:52.206 INFO  - Slot Event  *** Slot: 133499, Block:    ... empty, Epoch: 4171, Finalized checkpoint: 4034, Finalized root: abfa25..d2c4, Peers: 5
13:00:00.214 INFO  - Sync Event  *** Current slot: 133500, Head slot: 133428, Connected peers: 6
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM warning: Potentially dangerous stack overflow in ReservedStackAccess annotated method java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$Sync.tryAcquireShared(I)I [1]
```

### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Software version: [`teku --version`]
`teku/v0.11.4-dev-b3262903/linux-x86_64/-privatebuild-openjdk64bitservervm-java-13`

**Update:** I increased the max stack size via `JAVA_OPTS=-Xss8m ` and that has allowed Teku to rejoin Witti and make progress without the error recurring.

I think the default is 1m in my environment. Smaller than 8m might have been OK, but, in any case, this does does not seem like an ideal long-term "fix".
